hackathon-description-text: Today's most exciting use cases for blockchain technology extend far beyond payments and digital currency. New protocols that offer much more robust programming capabilities than bitcoin have ushered in the era of the "smart contract," and expectations are sky-high for what that could mean in industries ranging from capital markets trading, digital rights management, new peer-to-peer insurance models, and the internet of things.
hackathon-eligibility:
Participants must be 18 years of age or older, to qualify to win. 
Team size is 1 - 4 participants.
hackathon-requirements:
Signup to rehearse on Saturday. 
Rehearse on Sunday morning.
Submit project and team to Devpost by 3 pm Sunday at the latest. Only minimal data is required in Devpost - eg the Title, Team, brief description. However the more data provided the better; if you have a presentation or video, include it in the Devpost.
hackathon-rules:
Team size 1 - 4 people (remote team member is ok, tho all presentations are in person)
Required in order to be able to have a valid submission and to be able to present to the judges:
Rehearsals will be scheduled in 10 minute slots from 10 am - 1 pm on Sunday, May 21, 2017.
You may have up to two slides.
Recommendations: Rehearse your pitch. Spend 30 seconds or less on your slide(s). Spend as much time as possible showing what you built over the weekend.
 
Rehearsal signups will begin Saturday evening, May 20, 2017.

Hackathon Code of Conduct:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best hack using blockchain / DLT technology!
Develop an app with the highest potential for commercialization.
Blockchain Based Agricultural Microinsurance to solve the issue of under-insured across the globe.
Build a comprehensive digital identity solutions(application, ideally mobile) based on blockchain technology
Implement any board game as a blockchain app w/ 1 or more Hyperledger
Best application for smart city using any dlt/blockchain technology.
Use an Enterprise Ethereum Alliance stack (Quorum, BlockApps, and Nuco) to create a decentralized Dutch auction network with secret bid matching.
Leverage Microsoft Azure as part of your blockchain project.
Most innovative use of IBM blockchain services.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=30 Rockefeller Plaza, New York, NY 10112, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Did you practice? Will an investor understand well enough to invest?
Is it big? is it small? is it just a hack?
Use of Blockchain / distributed ledger technology

hackathon-location-address: 30 Rockefeller Plaza, New York, NY 10112, USA
hackathon-description-header: Join us for a weekend of hacking, hustling, and deep-diving into the blockchain industry's most cutting edge DLT developer tools.
